result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:06 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Randy D Blevins in court, in custody.  Attorney Alexander J. Kostal in court for Randy D Blevins. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. Alleged victim in court. 
Matter set to address Defense's bond motion to reduce cash bond. 
Defense gives brief statement as to motion and requests modification. 
State indicates the victim informed her this morning that he has been still trying to contact her, objects to modification and may be filing new charges. 
BTC: BOND MODIFICATION: Denied. 
Defense asks information about how to get belongings back. 
BTC: Atty Kostal is allowed act as third party to get belongings back if parties agree. 
Defense asks about conditions for no contact with service animal. 
State objects due to there being a charge just for the alleged abuse of the service animal and asks to address contempt order. 
BTC: Matter set over.
